description: A cognitive breakthrough workflow that generates three distinct solution approaches for complex problems with conflicting constraints: logical, ethical, and a creative fusion of both.
author: ArchE - ResonantiA Protocol v3.1-CA

problem_description.description: The complex problem with multiple, conflicting constraints

constraints.description: List of conflicting constraints that make the problem challenging

context.description: Additional context about the problem domain

workflow_steps.name: Problem Decomposition
workflow_steps.description: Break down the complex problem into its core components and identify constraint conflicts
workflow_steps.llm_prompt: Analyze the following complex problem and decompose it into its core components. Identify the specific conflicts between constraints and explain why this creates cognitive fixation. Problem: {problem_description}. Constraints: {constraints}

workflow_steps.name: Logical Solution Generation
workflow_steps.description: Generate a purely logical, optimization-based solution
workflow_steps.llm_prompt: Generate a purely logical solution to this problem. Focus on optimization, efficiency, and rational decision-making. Ignore ethical considerations for this solution. Problem: {problem_description}. Constraints: {constraints}

workflow_steps.name: Ethical Solution Generation
workflow_steps.description: Generate a solution based on moral principles and ethical frameworks
workflow_steps.llm_prompt: Generate an ethically-grounded solution to this problem. Focus on moral principles, stakeholder welfare, and ethical frameworks. Prioritize doing what's right over what's efficient. Problem: {problem_description}. Constraints: {constraints}

workflow_steps.name: Creative Fusion Generation
workflow_steps.description: Create a bizarre but intriguing fusion of logical and ethical approaches
workflow_steps.llm_prompt: Create a creative, unconventional solution that fuses elements from both the logical and ethical approaches in unexpected ways. This should be 'bizarre but intriguing' - think outside conventional frameworks. Use metaphorical thinking, lateral connections, and novel combinations. Problem: {problem_description}. Constraints: {constraints}. Logical approach: {logical_solution}. Ethical approach: {ethical_solution}

workflow_steps.name: Cognitive Fixation Analysis
workflow_steps.description: Analyze how each solution addresses cognitive fixation patterns
workflow_steps.llm_prompt: Analyze how each of the three solutions addresses the cognitive fixation patterns identified in the original problem. Which solution best breaks through conventional thinking? Why?

workflow_steps.name: Final Synthesis and Recommendation
workflow_steps.description: Synthesize insights and provide a recommendation
workflow_steps.llm_prompt: Based on the three solutions generated, provide a final analysis and recommendation. Which approach (or combination) would you recommend and why? How does this address the original cognitive fixation issue?

quality_checks.description: Ensure the three solutions are sufficiently different from each other
Verify that all constraints are addressed in at least one solution
Assess the novelty and creativity of the fusion solution

input.problem_description: A pharmaceutical company must decide whether to price a life-saving drug at $1000 per dose (ensuring profitability and R&D funding) or $10 per dose (ensuring accessibility for all patients).
constraints: Must maintain profitability for continued R&D
Must ensure drug accessibility for all patients

expected_output.logical_solution: Optimize pricing based on market segmentation and cost-benefit analysis
expected_output.ethical_solution: Implement tiered pricing based on patient ability to pay
expected_output.fusion_solution: Create a 'pay-it-forward' system where wealthy patients subsidize others through a blockchain-based transparency system
